item.description:
TC: Richard

EVENT: Ipswich River, Mass Audubon?s largest sanctuary, offers more than 10 miles of interconnecting trails that invite you to explore the forests, meadows, and wetlands. Climb the drumlin and esker, landscape features created by a glacier 15,000 years ago. Huge rocks and exotic trees and shrubs that were part of a former arboretum provide an adventurous walk along the Rockery Trail. Rain cancels.
RSVP: Requested, but not required.

MEET: 11:00 AM in the sanctuary parking lot located at 87 Perkins Row, Topsfield, MA

From Boston and the south: Take Rt I-95 north to exit 50 and follow Rt 1 north. At the junction of Rt 1 and Rt 97, turn right onto Rt 97 south (toward Beverly and Danvers). Follow Rt 97 south and take the third left onto Perkins Row. Follow Perkins Row for 1 mile, and the sanctuary is on the right.

From the north: Take Rt I-95 south to exit 53A and follow Rt 97 south. At the junction of Rt 1 and Rt 97 in Topsfield, stay on Rt 97 south and take the third left onto Perkins Row. Follow Perkins Row for 1 mile, and the sanctuary is on the right.

COST: $4 Audubon entrance fee plus $5 for nonmembers
item.how_to_find_us: Send a message to Rick at: email: kline@aoainc.com (work only) or 978 535-1903 before 9 PM to learn about the plans for getting together.
item.why: The Sanctuary has over 10 miles of trails and 8 miles of a river that runs through it. This trip will be an excellent opportuntiy to learn about a beautiful park and on the 1st Mass Audubon is having a Nature Festival there.

group.name: Mosaic Jewish Outdoor Club of Massachusetts

item.name: IPSWICH RIVER WILDLIFE SANCTUARY
